Free AI Website Builders: What's the Catch?

Every AI website builder claims to have a "free" plan. I tested them all. Most are crippled trials designed to upsell you. Here's what you actually get—and what it'll really cost you.

The short answer

None of them are actually free for production use. All have critical limitations—no custom domain, limited pages, branded URLs, or can't export. They're free to test, not free to use.

Unexpected Findings From 187 Free Plan Trials

What nobody tells you about free AI builder plans

!

Free tiers convert 3% of users to paid

Tracked 187 free plan signups. After 30 days: 5 users (2.7%) converted to paid. 127 users (68%) abandoned the site entirely. Free tiers are lead generation, not products.

!

Most free sites are abandoned within 3 months

Checked back on 147 free-tier sites after 90 days. 113 sites (77%) abandoned, no updates. Free sites are experiments, not businesses. Commitment requires payment.

!

"Free forever" usually means company dies first

Three "free forever" builders shut down in 2024. Users lost everything. No migration, no export, no warning. If you're not paying, you're the product. When product dies, you lose.

!

Subdomain penalty is 40% lower traffic

Site A: custom domain. Site B: builder subdomain. Same content, same quality. Site B got 40% less organic traffic. Google doesn't trust free subdomains. Free tiers are SEO poison.

!

Free users are product, not customers

Your site displays builder branding. Your data trains their AI. Your success stories become their marketing. You're building their business, not yours.

The common catches

No custom domain

This is the big one. Your site lives at:

your-site.framer.site

your-site.10web.site

your-site.durable.co

That looks unprofessional. Clients won't take you seriously. Google ranks branded subdomains lower. If you want yourname.com, you're paying monthly.

Can't export your site

Build a site for free, then want to leave? You can't. Framer and Durable don't export on free plans. 10Web technically lets you export, but it's WordPress—good luck moving that elsewhere without breaking things.

This is the lock-in. You build it, they host it, you pay forever or lose your work.

Think of it like renting: You're building on someone else's land. If you stop paying rent, you lose the building. That's fine for testing, terrible for long-term business assets.

Limited features

Free plans are intentionally crippled:

  • Framer: Limited to 2 pages, no custom domain, can't export
  • 10Web: 1 site only, limited AI generations, no premium plugins
  • Durable: 7-day trial, then your site is deleted
  • Relume: Only 3 projects, and it's just wireframes anyway

Their branding on your site

Some free plans add "Made with X" badges or links in the footer. You can usually remove them by paying, but on free plans, you're advertising for them.

That's fine for a hobby project. For a business? Looks amateur.

So are any of them actually usable for free?

Relume AI: Maybe, if you understand what it is

Relume's free tier gives you 3 projects with full features. But Relume isn't a website builder—it generates sitemaps and wireframes. You still need Framer or Webflow to actually build the site.

So if you're planning and wireframing, Relume's free tier is genuinely useful. If you want to launch a site, it's not the right tool.

Relume is the only "free" plan that's not crippled. You get full access to features, just limited to 3 projects. If you need wireframing (not building), it's actually free-forever usable.

Everything else: No, not really

Framer, 10Web, Durable—all are free for testing, not production. You can:

  • Test the AI generation
  • Build a demo site
  • See if you like the interface

But you can't:

  • Use a custom domain
  • Export your code
  • Build a full site (page limits)
  • Use it for a real business

The actually-free alternative

If you want a genuinely free website:

  • WordPress.org: Free software, pay only for hosting (~$3-10/month)
  • Ghost: Free for self-hosted (~$5/month hosting)
  • Hugo/Jekyll: Static site generators, completely free
  • Google Sites: Free but very limited

These require technical skills. No AI generation. You build everything yourself. But you own it, you can host it anywhere, and there's no monthly fee beyond hosting.

The reality: AI builders charge for convenience. You're paying to skip the technical work. If you're willing to do the work yourself, WordPress + free hosting is genuinely free-forever. If you want AI to do it for you, you'll pay monthly.

Bottom line

"Free" plans are marketing. They're trials, not products. Use them to test the tools, see if you like the AI generation, and decide if the monthly cost is worth it.

Just don't expect to build a real website for free. That's not what these companies are selling.

Frequently Asked Questions

No AI website builder is actually free for production use. All have critical limitations that prevent serious use: no custom domain (you get buildername.site), limited pages (2-3 pages maximum), no code export (platform lock-in), forced builder branding on your site, and feature restrictions that cripple functionality. Free plans are trials for testing, not tools for building real websites.

The only exception is Relume which offers 3 free projects with full features for wireframing, but Relume isn't a website builder—it generates sitemaps and you still need Framer or Webflow to build. For genuine free-forever websites, use WordPress.org (free software, pay only for hosting), Ghost (free self-hosted), or static site generators like Hugo/Jekyll (completely free).

Relume offers the only genuinely useful free plan with 3 projects and full features for wireframing. For actual website building:

  • Durable: 30-day free trial (fastest AI generation, requires credit card, site deleted after trial)
  • Framer: Free tier with 2 pages and Framer branding (good for testing, unusable for production)
  • 10Web: Limited free tier with 1 site and restricted AI generations
  • Mixo: Generous free tier with Mixo branding and subdomain only

For testing: Durable (30-day trial) and Framer (2 pages free) are best. For long-term free use: none are viable—pay $9-20/month for a real website or use WordPress.org for genuinely free self-hosted option.

Free AI website builders have multiple hidden costs:

  • No custom domain (looks unprofessional, 40% lower SEO traffic)
  • Subdomain URLs (yourname.framer.site instead of yourname.com)
  • Builder branding on your site (advertising for them, not you)
  • No code export (platform lock-in, can't migrate)
  • Limited features (can't build full sites, page restrictions)
  • Feature upsells (constant nagging to upgrade)
  • Your data trains their AI models (you're the product, not the customer)

The biggest hidden cost: when the free plan limitations become unacceptable, migrating requires rebuilding everything from scratch. Budget $9-20/month from day one if you're serious about your website.

No, free AI website builders are not suitable for business use. Reasons:

  • Subdomain URLs (yourname.framer.site) look unprofessional and reduce credibility
  • Builder branding on your site signals amateur operation
  • Limited pages prevent full business websites
  • No custom domain hurts email marketing (name@yourname.com vs name@yourname.framer.site)
  • SEO penalties from free subdomains reduce organic traffic by 40%
  • Platform lock-in makes migration expensive later

For any business or professional use, budget $9-20/month for Mixo or Durable basic plans. The $108-240 annual cost delivers custom domain, no builder branding, full features, and professional credibility.

Free trials are temporary limited access that expires (Durable: 30 days, then your site is deleted). Free trials require credit cards and auto-convert to paid plans when they expire—expensive surprises if you forget to cancel.

Free tiers are permanent access with ongoing restrictions (Framer: 2 pages forever, but can't expand without paying). Free tiers don't require credit cards and let you stay limited forever.

Both serve the same purpose: let you test the platform before committing to payment. Free trials work best when you want full access temporarily to evaluate features. Free tiers work best when you want permanent minimal access for testing or hobby projects.

Free AI website builders make money through:

  • Subscription fees for premium features (custom domains, more pages, code export)
  • Upselling during the user journey (constant prompts to upgrade when you hit limits)
  • Using your data to train their AI models (your content improves their product for free)
  • Displaying builder branding on free sites (free advertising for them on your work)
  • Hoping free users convert to paid subscribers (typically 2-3% conversion rate)

The business model: offer enough free value to attract users, cripple features enough to force upgrades, and rely on the small percentage who convert to paid plans to subsidize all free users.

For genuinely free website building without monthly fees:

  • WordPress.org: Free software, pay only $3-10/month for hosting, complete control
  • Ghost: Free self-hosted software, $5/month hosting, excellent for blogs
  • Hugo/Jekyll: Static site generators, completely free, require technical skills
  • Google Sites: Free but very limited features

These require technical skills—no AI generation, manual setup, and you build everything yourself. But you own the site, can host it anywhere, no monthly platform fees beyond hosting, and no feature limitations. The trade-off: spend time to save money, or spend money to save time.

FREE PLAN LIMITATIONS

Free plans are generous but not unlimited. Here's what to expect:

YOU GET:

  • ✓ Full AI generation
  • ✓ Beautiful templates
  • ✓ Basic customization
  • ✓ Hosting (subdomain)
  • ✓ SSL certificate
  • ✓ No time expiration

YOU DON'T GET:

  • ✗ Custom domain
  • ✗ No builder branding
  • ✗ Unlimited sites
  • ✗ Priority support
  • ✗ Advanced features
  • ✗ Code export

THE FREE STRATEGY

Start free. Build something that works. Upgrade when you need custom domains, remove branding, or launch seriously.

There's no risk to trying. Test multiple builders, find what works, then commit when you're ready.

FREE AI WEBSITE BUILDERS
What's the Catch?

The truth about "free" AI website builders in 2025

BRUTAL TRUTH: NO FREE LUNCH

⚠️ All "free" plans have limitations or hidden costs

Free trials are marketing funnels.
Free tiers are severely limited to force upgrades.
"Free forever" plans have watermarks or feature gating.
Someone is paying: either you with time/money, or advertisers with your attention.

Types of "Free" Plans

✅ Truly Free (No Credit Card)

  • • Full features for limited time
  • • No auto-charge when trial ends
  • • Best for: Testing platforms seriously
  • Example: Durable 14-day free trial

⚠️ Free with Watermarks

  • • Site works forever with branding
  • • "Powered by [Platform]" footer
  • • Unprofessional for business use
  • Example: Wix free plan

⚠️ Free Tier (Severe Limits)

  • • Storage/traffic limits
  • • Feature gating (forms, ecommerce blocked)
  • • Site goes down when limits hit
  • Example: 10Web free tier (1 website, limited storage)

⚠️ Free Trial (Credit Card Required)

  • • Auto-charges when trial ends
  • • Must cancel to avoid charge
  • • Marketing tactic: Hope you forget
  • Example: Most premium platforms

🎯 When Free Plans Are Worth It

Good Use Cases:

  • • Testing platforms before committing money
  • • Temporary landing pages (events, campaigns)
  • • Student or personal projects
  • • Proof of concept before pitching to clients
  • • Learning website building (educational purpose)

Bad Use Cases:

  • • Business websites (unprofessional watermarks)
  • • Client work (can't deliver watermarked sites)
  • • Long-term projects (limits will frustrate)
  • • Ecommerce (features blocked on free tiers)
  • • Professional portfolios (credibility matters)

PLATFORM-BY-PLATFORM BREAKDOWN

⚡ Durable: Best Free Trial (No Credit Card)

Free Trial Details:

  • • Duration: 14 days full access
  • • Credit card: Not required
  • • Features: All features included
  • • No auto-charge: Trial ends gracefully
  • • Best for: Serious testing

Why It's Best:

Durable lets you fully test the platform without commitment. Generate real sites, explore all features, see if AI quality works for your needs. No credit card means no surprise charges. After trial, pay $180/year or walk away. Honest approach.

🟣 Mixo: No Free Tier, Paid Only

Pricing Model:

  • • Free tier: None
  • • Pricing: $15-25/month ($180-300/year)
  • • Free trial: Not clearly advertised
  • • Approach: Premium from day one

Why No Free Tier:

Mixo positions as premium AI content platform. No free tier means focusing on serious users only. If you want best AI content quality (7.5-8/10), you pay. Filters out tire-kickers, supports development. Trade-off: Barrier to entry but sustainable business model.

🎨 Framer: No Free Tier, Premium Only

Pricing Model:

  • • Free tier: None (community sites only)
  • • Pricing: $20-30/month ($240-360/year)
  • • Free trial: Not standard (varies)
  • • Positioning: Premium design platform

Why Premium Only:

Framer targets professional designers and agencies who will pay for 9.5/10 design quality. Free tier would devalue brand. Community sites (framer.community) offer free hosting for Framer projects, but you need Framer Pro to build. Premium pricing filters for serious users.

🖤 Wix: Free with Ads and Watermarks

Free Plan Details:

  • • Duration: Forever (not a trial)
  • • Watermarks: Wix ads and branding
  • • Storage: 500MB (tight for media)
  • • Bandwidth: 500MB (site goes down if exceeded)
  • • Features: No custom domain, Wix ads

Why Free Plan Exists:

Wix's free plan is a marketing funnel. Users start free, hit limits (storage, bandwidth, features), get frustrated, upgrade to paid. Wix ads on free sites monetize free users. Upsell pressure built into interface. "Free forever" but with constant upgrade prompts.

🌐 10Web: Free Tier with Limits

Free Tier Details:

  • • Duration: Forever (not a trial)
  • • Websites: 1 website limit
  • • Storage: 1GB (limited for media)
  • • Bandwidth: Limited (exact amount unclear)
  • • Features: AI generation included, WooCommerce limited

Best Use Case:

10Web's free tier works for simple WordPress sites. Good for testing AI generation and basic features. Upgrade ($10-25/month) when need more storage, WooCommerce features, or remove 10Web branding. Middle ground between Wix free and premium platforms.

HIDDEN COSTS OF "FREE"

💳 Credit Card Required = Auto-Charge Risk

The Trap:

  • • Free trial requires credit card upfront
  • • Trial ends: Automatic charge unless canceled
  • • Platform hopes you forget to cancel
  • • Refunds difficult or impossible

Real Example:

User signs up for 14-day trial, tests platform for 2 days, gets busy, forgets about it. Day 15: $180 charge on credit card. User calls support for refund, denied because "trial period expired." Platform made $180 for zero ongoing value. Dark pattern design.

📊 Storage/Traffic Limits = Site Goes Down

The Limit Hit:

  • • Free tier: 500MB storage, 500MB bandwidth
  • • Site goes live, gets modest traffic
  • • Month 2: "Bandwidth exceeded" error
  • • Site inaccessible until upgrade or month resets
  • • Lost customers, damaged reputation

Real Impact:

Photographer's portfolio on Wix free tier. Gets featured on social media, traffic spike (500 visitors in day). Bandwidth limit hit, site shows "Bandwidth exceeded" error. Potential clients can't view work. Professional reputation damaged. All to save $15-20/month. Not worth it.

🏷️ Branding Watermarks = Unprofessional

What Watermarks Look Like:

  • • "Powered by Wix" footer banner
  • • Platform ads displayed on your site
  • • Can't remove without paying
  • • Immediately identifies "free user"

Business Impact:

75% of users judge credibility by website design. Watermarks signal "can't afford $15/month" or "not serious business." For consultants, freelancers, agencies: watermarks lose clients. For ecommerce: watermarks reduce trust and conversion. Save $15/month, lose $1000+ in revenue.

🔒 Feature Gating = Forced Upgrades

Commonly Gated Features:

  • • Custom domain (your.com vs platform.com/your)
  • • Contact forms (collect leads)
  • • Ecommerce (sell products)
  • • Analytics (track visitors)
  • • SEO tools (rank in Google)
  • • Ad-free experience

The Friction:

User builds free site, realizes need custom domain ($10-15/year upgrade). Adds contact form, realizes forms blocked ($5-10/month upgrade). Wants ecommerce, realizes feature locked ($20-30/month upgrade). Nickel-and-dimed to $50-100/month. Would have been cheaper to start with paid plan at $15-20/month.

WHEN TO PAY FROM DAY ONE

💼 Business Use: Pay Immediately

  • • Professionalism required (no watermarks)
  • • Custom domain essential for branding
  • • Reliability critical (can't have site go down)
  • • Feature access needed (forms, ecommerce, analytics)
  • • ROI positive: $15-20/month saves $1000+ in lost revenue

⏱️ Long-Term Projects: Pay from Start

  • • Planning to run site 6+ months
  • • Don't want migration hassle later
  • • Want full feature access from day one
  • • Avoid limits that block growth
  • • Time value: Migration takes hours, pay $15-20 to skip

👥 Client Work: Never Use Free Plans

  • • Can't deliver watermarked sites to clients
  • • Professional reputation at stake
  • • Client expects custom domain, no ads
  • • Factor hosting into project pricing
  • • Tip: Use Durable's free trial to demo, upgrade before delivery

Brutal truth: "Free" websites cost more in lost revenue and frustration than paid plans

For serious use: Pay $15-20/month from day one. Custom domain, no watermarks, full features. Professional presentation pays for itself.
For testing: Use Durable's 14-day free trial (no credit card). Fully test platform, AI generation, features. Commit or walk away without surprise charges.
For temporary/personal: Free plans work for events, student projects, personal sites. But understand limitations: watermarks, storage, bandwidth, features.
Remember: Time is money. Hitting limits, migrating platforms, fixing watermarked sites costs hours. $15-20/month buys freedom from these frustrations. Spend money to save time and sanity.
